open-source python library for machine learning that focuses mainly in data

that was a very brief overview of the psyit learn library and now let's dive a little bit into what is array
API array API is a specification that standardizes the core functions and
behaviors of array libraries in Python to improve interoperability what that really long
sentence means is that because python is entirely open source there exist a lot
of libraries that python programmers can leverage so that they can use functions
out of the box versus writing them from scratch this is really convenient but
there is a slight problem with that there are a lot of common functions
in more than one Library you could do sum and mean from a lot of libraries
that exist for python but their behaviors are slightly different as in
they expect different inputs and different outputs the input could be different numbers of inputs different
types of inputs and different formats this makes working with these
libraries a little bit difficult because you can't use more than just one library in the same project unless you do some
modification in between them to make them inter
interoperable the array API standard aims to address that problem by standardizing common functions like sum
or mean so that they work the same way across different libraries so that that means Su and mean and a lot of other
functions are expected to have the same type of input same number of inputs and
same type of output same format of the output as well as the same number of
outputs is second learn though there are three main things that we are trying to
achieve by adopting a ray API most functions in C alarn are
written in numai which is CPU native and you don't see a problem when your data
set is small but as your data set increases in size you'll notice that CPU
training becomes quite slow with array API these CPU native algorithms can run
on gpus because we're able to feed them a GPU namespaced array such as P toward
or QP and therefore the training can happen on gpus and it will vastly increase
performance there is something called just time compilers or jit compilers which compile code while the program is
running as opposed to compiling everything before runtime then it runs
as you can imagine this greatly increases performance however jit compilers have
very strict expectations on the input output and behaviors of functions which
currently are aligned with what py learn has to offer however aray API standards
expectation of these functions are exactly the same as jit compilers which means that by adopting the array API
standard we will be able to leverage jit compilers as well similar to jit compilers dask arays
also have very strict expectations on the behavior input and outputs of functions that you would like to use
dasar Ray on and dasar Ray expectations also align with the array API
standard in the current stage of the array API standard adoption ins K learn
we are mainly focused on getting the first point across which is getting numpy functions to not only take numai

containers was a uh containers is a concept that has been there in Linux for a very long time uh c groups name spaces
and all of that but uh container as we know it today was popularized by Docker in
2013 uh Docker changed the way we package and ship software uh they made
it easy they made it easy so that you can uh run code on your machine as how you
would run it on any other machine so uh you wouldn't have the challenges of
setting up a traditional virtual machine where you would have a different setup for your development environment versus
production so this diagram that we see here is a quick uh like a comparison of how uh
containers are different from like regular VMS so if you're using containerization
technology to run your software the underlying machine or the host in which
the software is running would have a container runtime running and this container runtime can be Docker or
container D or crayo any uh any of these uh Alternatives that
that we have today and uh we would create container images which would have
all the uh necessary uh information on what all we need to have to run our
software so if it was like if you were running this on a regular virtual machine or a like a physical server on a
rack you would have to uh like install all the dependencies of your software to
be able to run the code and let's say if you want to replicate this across multiple machines you would have to do
the same setup across all these machines so the difficulty here is that if you
are trying to run the same code on different kinds of machines uh different
kind as in there can be different architectures uh there can be different operating systems and if you if you want
to run your code across all these different kinds of machines you would have to uh like do the initial setup in
a different way so you would have to uh like there would be one way in which you would be installing a particular
dependency on a Linux machine versus a BSD machine or a Windows machine and it would also depend on the version of the
operating system that you're using so Docker makes it easy if you able to install Docker on a
particular host uh with any kind of host if Docker is running if the docker container runtime is running you would
be able to run the software with the same Docker file across different uh different architectures and different
kinds of machines so uh that kind of Technology was popularized by uh Docker in 2013 and it changed the
way people think about shipping and packaging software so what happened after that was we started seeing very uh
High adoption of containers because it uh made development like cycle easier
and faster and it also let users run their code in their machines the same
way they would run it on production so we started seeing a very uh High spike in the usage of containers
and there came a need where we had to manage hundreds or thousands of
containers so it was at this point in time that kubernetes was open sourced so
kubernetes was uh based on a container orchestration system within Google
called bog and uh the current version of kubernetes that we know was Bas built
based on bog and it was open sourced in 2014 so uh this year we had the 10th
anniversary of kubernetes and basically what kubernetes does is it uh manages
these containers for you so in the diagram that we saw here uh of course
containers does solve a lot of our problems uh in shipping the software but how do you ensure that the containers
themselves are running so if you have like very few amount of containers let's
say if you have like two containers for your application you might be able to to manage it yourself but if you're talking
about like hundreds or thousands of containers it becomes increasingly difficult to uh manage it all on your
own manually so that is where something like kubernetes uh comes into a picture
and with kubernetes we can manage uh like hundreds or thousands of containers you might have heard some numbers in the
